intro: Bromopsis erecta subsp. gordjaginii, commonly known as the Gorganii bromus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
